channel.title: Is thumbs.db malicious?
channel.description:
So i wanted to download the vulcan source and client, but my client keeps getting the error, request title screen. (ofcourse i putted cache in right folder).
But people kept saying, put ur cache in the right map, so i made a video to show them that i [B]did[/B] do that. But once recording i saw the error, "C:\Vulcan\Sprites\Thumbs.db (Acces denied)"
Here is the video [youtube]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z7eq1tLUlwo&list=UUcVtXP4iJlZJUa153X5p-jA[/youtube]
Now my quetion is, is this malicious?
And another question is, how do i get this cache up running corretly :)

item.title: Is thumbs.db malicious?
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

yeah I know vix personally he wouldn’t infect his download with anything

Read full topic

item.title: Is thumbs.db malicious?
item.dc:creator: @oldschool-scape oldschool-scape
item.description:
@oldschool-scape wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:545867”][quote author=oldschool-scape link=topic=664750.msg4443710#msg4443710 date=1407791827]

it’s a windows file for keeping track of the thumbnails for the folder. its not malicious.

Ah thanks, any idea’s how i can get this cache rollin’?
[/quote]
Pack the cache into a zip.
Open it with a program like WinRAR.
Go through all the folders (still in WinRAR)
and delete all the thumbs.db from each one.
Each time you delete one, it will repack the archive. It gets tedious. But after you removed em all that should fix the error.[/quote]

thx for the help man!
Will try ;D

Read full topic

item.title: Is thumbs.db malicious?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“oldschool-scape, post:3, topic:545867”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=664750.msg4443707#msg4443707 date=1407791502]
it’s a windows file for keeping track of the thumbnails for the folder. its not malicious.
[/quote]

Ah thanks, any idea’s how i can get this cache rollin’?[/quote]
Pack the cache into a zip.
Open it with a program like WinRAR.
Go through all the folders (still in WinRAR)
and delete all the thumbs.db from each one.
Each time you delete one, it will repack the archive. It gets tedious. But after you removed em all that should fix the error.

Read full topic
